page.title: 20Low Town - High Town
page.content: As the River Severn makes it way down to the Bristol Channel it winds through the Severn Valley and in Bridgnorth, divides the town into Low Town and High Town. A steep road, skirting the remains of the Castle which lean perilously, takes tourists into the centre of High Town. From here, it is possible to walk along the Castle Walk overlooking the River and Low Town below. King Charles is alleged to have said that the view from here was the best in his kingdom. Traditionally, people have associated Low Town with the rough characters who made their living from the river and its various trades and High Town with the traders, the burgesses and the more noble folk of Bridgnorth. In the 20th. century, great efforts have been made to develop Low Town and to remove the division that has existed so long.
